metadata.name: Potential Ruby Reverse Shell
metadata.comment: Detects execution of ruby with the "-e" flag and calls to "socket" related functions. This could be an indication of a potential attempt to setup a reverse shell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND contains(lower(process.name), lower('ruby')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -e')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('rsocket')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tcpsocket')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' bsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' csh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' pdksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' tcsh'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of ruby with the "-e" flag and calls to "socket" related functions. This could be an indication of a potential attempt to setup a reverse shell
